Buy IPTs, fix science forever.

For too long, outdated funding systems have slowed scientific progress. Crypto can fix science, but we need your help.

Meet Catalyst, the #DeSci funding machine that lets YOU decide the future of science.

DeSci doesn't only make promising academic research fundable, but also earnable. This is going to be  for attracting and incentivizing swarms of talented individuals to fast-track research into solutions for patients and the planet. Web3 will make this frictionless.

IPTs don't stop there!

Catalyst democratizes funding for early-stage research by connecting researchers with a global network of funders.

With Catalyst, you can fund research projects directly & receive IPTs in exchange 

Contribute to active research projects on Catalyst

There's a lot of excitement in crypto around RWAs. However, unlike loans and bonds, IP is the ultimate meta-RWA—an asset perfect for tokenization.

How? Through IPTs.

Let's look at two IPTs launched by 
@vita_dao
 that are pioneering onchain science and longevity research

Onchain science is already underway & making incredible strides.
@vita_dao
 is leading the charge with two remarkable projects combating age-related diseases:

 VitaFAST - Restoring autophagy function in aged cells
 $VitaRNA - Suppressing mutations that drive aging

What do IPTs mean for scientific innovation? 

IPTs help accelerate research by aligning incentives around a community of stakeholders that have an opportunity to govern IP and contribute to the research itself.

Now, let's take a look at some case studies

A quick primer on IPTs 

Intellectual Property Tokens (IPTs): fungible governance tokens of an IPT-NFT (a tokenized representation of IP)

IPTs transform how research IP is managed, governed, & monetized—enabling open-source collaboration without losing commercial opportunity.

Having launched two drugs in big pharma, I’ve seen how the system works—and more importantly, where it’s broken. 

To fix a broken system, incentives must align. In scientific research, what is that substrate?

There's only one answer: IP
Meet the Researchers - Project Prima Donna https://x.com/i/broadcasts/1djGXrvkEXvxZ…

Dr. Hannele Ruohola-Baker and Dr. David Baker shared research achievements early on in their careers, and subsequently moved to 
@UW

Want to support Hannele's work?

In a world-first, Dr. Ruohola-Baker has figured out how to grow enamel, the hard shiny material responsible for glowing smiles. With support from two other senior researchers, Hannele is asking the DeSci community to help further their research.
If the project reaches its funding goal you will receive intellectual property tokens (IPTs), granting governance rights over the resulting IP. Pretty damn cool!!

AI and LLMs are rapidly shifting how we work, and science is no different. 

The conversation around drug discovery is particularly intriguing.

With drug development costs of $2.6B and a 90% failure rate, pharma needs AI more than ever.

But is AI living up to its promise?

The future of pharma isn't just AI - it's decentralized, community-owned, and happening in DeSci!

Let's accelerate science together!

Just look at what DeSci has accomplished through the 
@vita_dao
 $VITARNA project.

The DeSci community raised over $300,000 to fund onchain science

A discovery made in C. elegans just scored the Nobel Prize, mainly because the finding was conserved in larger life forms, including us humans. 

Imagine what more discoveries can be made with 
@pumpdotscience
 if thousands of molecules are screened on this same model.

@valley_dao
 has some exciting things GROWing

A population-wide study in Taiwan found that people with herpes were 2.56 times more likely to develop Alzheimer's Disease. 

Dr. Daniel Bar is trying to understand more
Dr. Bar is trying to figure this out! He hopes that if he can identify the protective proteins in healthy people, he can find a way to replicate that in at-risk people!
He is currently raising funds to continue his research, you can check out the project page on Catalyst
Both of these viruses are very common - so why do they make some people more prone to Alzhiemer's Disease and yet other people aren't impacted?

Even the tiniest genetic mutations can wreak havoc on our health. 

But what if we could STOP them in their tracks?

That's exactly what 
@vita_dao
 and 
@Mykalt45
 of Artan Bio are working on with $VITARNA.

Artan BIO isn't just advancing gene therapy. It's showing how decentralized communities can:

 Fund innovative research
 Create new incentive mechanisms
 Push science forward, faster

#DeSci is the future of scientific progress.

Read the entire blog article with Artan Bio's in vitro results below 

Join the VITARNA Telegram group: https://t.me/vitarna

What's next for Artan BIO? 

 Scale up production of their lead candidate, Artan-102
 Conduct animal studies

This will produce high-quality material sufficient for critical safety and efficacy studies before testing in humans is possible.

If you find science inspiring and want to take a more active role in guiding the future of Alzheimer's research, learn more about Project Transfidelity here

Did you know that increased errors in protein printing could lead to early aging & poor brain health?   Faulty proteins tangle & clump together, causing havoc in the body.

Project Transfidelity aims to improve protein printing accuracy. Interested in funding this research?
If you'd like to learn more about how two researchers from Switzerland are tackling faulty protein production, head over to Catalyst ☞

Science funding needs your help - so we brought it onchain. 

With Catalyst, we are making it easier than ever to fund scientific research ideas. A part of that is minimizing market friction to maximize acceleration.

We can achieve this using bonding curves.

Molecule has been exploring the use of bonding curves for funding science and distributing IP ownership for quite some time.

Check out 
@paulkhls
's article on IP-NFTs and Bonding Curves from 2018!

Molecule isn't just providing new tools and technologies for funding research. We are rethinking the entire system at every step!

Catch bonding curves in action by heading over to Catalyst and checking out the latest research project up for funding

In summary, both AMMs and bonding curves have their strengths.

AMMs excel in providing liquidity and trading efficiency at scale 

Bonding curves are ideal for nurturing early-stage token ecosystems, making them perfect for funding new scientific research!
